Looking for ways to become more involved with the HPA? If you’re interested in becoming a part of the HPA staff please check the volunteers page often as it will be being updated consistently. We are currently looking for new staffers to fill the following positions: Merchandise Coordinator, Video Editor, Social Networking Expert, General Staffers, and an Analytics Expert.
Hey everyone! This weeks weekly Wrap-Up Blog is up on the HPA home page! Check it out!

Are You Ready To Join The HPA Team?

We are always looking for dedicated members to join the staff team and help shape our future campaigns and projects. If you’re interested in becoming a part of the HPA staff please check the volunteer’s page often as it will be being updated consistently. Right now, we are currently looking for new staffers to fill the following positions: Merchandise Coordinator, Video Editor, Social Networking Expert, and an Analytics Expert. 

A more detailed description of each position can be found at www.thehpalliance.org/get-involved/join-staff

win $250K!

We have fallen from 
our number one spot in Chase Community Giving challenge on Facebook, and

place. Even if you can dedicate only a few hours next week, we 
can use you.

If you haven’t voted yet, go vote 
now!

In
which John visits with Esther, Katie, Maddie, Lindsay, Arka, Teryn, and

HPAFTW: The Final Battle! Be there July 10th, 12PM EST! Find us at http://www.livestream.com/sayaha
The Final Battle in ten minutes!
Head over to http://www.livestream.com/sayaha and join us as we work the final two days of the contest. And if for some reason you haven't voted yet, vote now! http://bit.ly/hpaftw
Hey guys, livestream happening right now! We need your help, just got some news. Only two days left! http://www.livestream.com/sayaha

Check out this video from our lovely volunteers! 
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yFsRfYginHE&feature=digest

If you have already voted (and we know most of you have), join us tomorrow Sunday July 12th at NOON EST time to do more to help! We are in danger of losing our lead in the FINAL TWO days, and we have easy, quick, assignments for everyone who can spare ten minutes of time. Be a part of Harry Potter fandom history:

http://www.livestream.com/sayaha

1 day, 12 hours left to vote! Get a friend to vote! The charity in 2nd place right now got 8,000 votes in less than 12 hours and they are still going! They will overtake us. Join us in our livestream at 12pm EST today to find out what you can do to help. www.livestream.com/sayaha

http://hpaforthewin.com
There will be another livestream at 9pm EST today to discuss the FINAL DAY of #hpaftw Be there! http://www.livestream.com/sayaha

Tom Milsom and Bobby from youtube.com/themefund put together this video with Andrew Slack and so many others! THANK YOU TOM! Go like, comment and subscribe, and get a friend to vote!  Vote at http://bit.ly/hpaftw

We are only a few hundred in the lead to win $250K, with less than 14 hours left to vote! Let's widen the gap... As Paul DeGeorge says, go get your facebook friends to vote! Send them a personal message! http://bit.ly/hpaftw 


13 hour, 26 minutes!

Less than 10 HOURS LEFT! We are back in 2nd place, its like tug of war! Every vote counts, go find a friend and get them to vote. We're only behind by 40 or so votes!

http://bit.ly/hpaftw
9 and 3/4 hours left to vote! WE are SOOOOO CLOSE! http://bit.ly/hpaftw

Less than 6 hours! We are 500 votes behind!

There is less than 6 hours left to vote! WE NEED YOUR HELP TO WIN FIRST! GO GET A FRIEND TO VOTE NOW! 

Send them to http://www.hpaforthewin.com. Here's how to vote. Click "Get started to vote now," allow access and "Like" the Chase Community Giving Application, and then click "Vote now" 

It is vital that everyone do everything that they can right now, so that we can $250,000 to fight real world evil! 

We have had incredible support from Nathan Fillion, Felicia Day, Shane Dawson, Hank and John Green, Dan Brown, Shaycarl, Tom Milsom, Maureen Johnson, Neil Gaimain, Tom Felton, Chris Rankin, Scott Westerfeld, Alan Lastufka, Charlie McDonnel, Alex Day, the list goes on and on! 

Warner Brothers itself has tweeted about us! 

Help us make Harry Potter Fandom History! 

Thank you! Thank you!
We are LIVE right now! In the final hours, the Final Battle and we are so close to winning $250K http://www.livestream.com/sayaha

Fewer than FOUR HOURS to go! Come hang out with us at our Livestream Channel (www.livestream.com/sayaha), our headquarters for HPA For The Win!

Join Nathan Fillion, Felicia Day, Shane Dawson, Hank and John Green, Dan Brown, Shaycarl, Tom Milsom, Maureen Johnson, Neil Gaimain, Tom Felton, Chris Rankin, Scott Westerfeld, Alan Lastufka, Charlie McDonnel, and Alex Day in supporting the AWESOME work the HPA does

Get over to www.hpaforthewin.com and VOTE for the Harry Potter Alliance!

THREE HOURS LEFT to get the vote out for The Harry Potter Alliance! We're SO CLOSE to winning, so now is the time to contact EVERYONE you know! Get those last few holdouts, the friends and family members you haven't seen in a few years and ASK them to vote!

If you don't tell them about the opportunity to vote, and where to vote, how can they find and vote for us? Get 5 people to vote now! We're in the home stretch!

ONE HOUR LEFT to VOTE for the Harry Potter Alliance! Follow up with everyone you've already talked to and make sure they've voted! Talk to your friends and family and make sure they voted! Bring up the page for them (www.hpaftw.com) and make sure they vote!
45 MINUTES TO GO! DON'T STOP NOW! Keep that momentum going and keep contacting your friends, neighbors, and anyone you can find to GO VOTE! www.hpaftw.com
30 MINUTES LEFT! We are down to the wire! Keep up the pace! Keep asking your friends! Keep getting those votes! www.hpaftw.com
TWENTY MINUTES LEFT! Don't focus on how many votes we have - keep getting as many votes as you can!
15 MINUTES LEFT! Keep it up! We have to keep the pace going! Vote at www.hpaftw.com and listen to Andrew Slack over at our "offices" at livestream.com/sayaha
FOUR MINUTES LEFT! LAST CHANCE TO GET THOSE VOTES! www.hpaforthewin.com

story: The Harry Potter Alliance added a life event from July 13, 2010: The Harry Potter Alliance Wins $250,000!

message:
The press conference where The Harry Potter Alliance will 
receive the check for $250,000 is today at 12:30pm in 
Orlando, Florida in the midst of Infinitus 2010. Among the attendees 
will be Melissa Anelli and Paul DeGeorge from our board of directors, 
as well as Andrew Slack himself is there to accept the check from Chase.

We’re working to find out if it will be livestreaming anywhere, so 
stay tuned.
The press conference will be broadcast LIVE at httP//www.livestream.com/sayaha. It starts in less than ten minutes!

The Harry Potter Alliance and JP Morgan Chase will be participating in a second press conference this weekend in San Diego at Comic-Con 2010!
At this this time, we do not know the exact time or location of the
press conference but we will update with more information as soon as
possible. We are working to see if we can broadcast this event live as
well. Stay tuned...

Hey guys! We need you're video submissions!

Please send them to videos@thehpalliance.org

We'd like to hear about your favorite HPA experience, tell everyone what the HPA means to you, and wish the HPA a happy birthday!

How are everyone's videos coming for the 10-10-10 anniversary bash?

(No idea what I'm talking about? WELL! We have put out a call for video submissions to compile into a made of awesome video for our 5th anniversary bash on October 10th! More details! http://bit.ly/bbhzIF)

Hey guys just one more reminder about the 10-10-10 BLOWOUT CELEBRATION!!!! Its going to be super awesome!

 As many of you may know, Esther Earl, a great friend of the HPA, died this August from cancer. Her father, Wayne Earl, will be attending the 10-10-10 event to speak about the community. We will be honoring her memory and how much of an impact the Harry Potter fandom had on Esther and her family. I know that this will be a very touching event so be sure not to miss it!
Are you guys as excited about the 10-10-10 BLOWOUT CELEBRATION as we are??
Did you know that even if you can't make it to the Anniversary Celebration IRL, you can still participate? We're hosting a Livestream too! How exciting is THAT? (Pretty darn exciting, I think. ^^)
The owls are excited for Sunday's event, are you? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A_qhVX3AYxU. Get your tickets here: http://bit.ly/hpatix

story: The Harry Potter Alliance added a life event from October 10, 2010: 10-10-10.

message:
It's 10-10-10 folks! Come celebrate with us if you're in the Boston area. We're at The Center for Arts in the Armory in Somerville, MA. Tickets are $11 at the door. CASH ONLY, please. 

If you can't be at the event join the rest of us on www.livestream.com/sayaha where you can still celebrate with us.

Performances include Harry and the Potters, The Whomping Willows, Lauren Fairweather, and Justin Finch Fletchly and the Sugar Quills and more! Plus there will be great videos and speeches from Andrew Slack, Paul DeGeorge and others.

Don't miss it!
Our 10-10-10 Blowout is on www.livestream.com/sayaha right now! Come join us!
It's not over Yet! Come watch our 10-10-10 Anniversary Blowout! http://www.livestream.com/sayaha
Thank you everyone for 5 years! Don't miss the next 5 years and beyond!  The weapon we have is love! <3
Check our new Imagine Better Blog! There are lots of posts from Andrew Slack  and other HPA staffers.

Hey guys! Guess what we're doing for Halloween? Hosting a livestream! Come and join us on the livestream at 2 PM EST as we launch the Deathly Hallows campaign and announce our first real-world Horcrux: economic injustice! So if nsafe working conditions, irresponsible business practices, and child labor make you say, "Boo!" then join us as we chat with everyone's favourite host, Andrew Slack. Don't forget your fair-trade candy. :)
The HPA wants YOU!!! Apply to join our staff today! Visit http://bit.ly/hpastaff to apply now!

Halloween is getting even closer - and you guys know what that means! The livestream to launch the Deathly Hallows campaign is getting even closer too! We're super excited to see you all at 2 pm EST on Sunday! (Oh, and did we mention that John Green is going to be there?)

See more info and RSVP here: http://on.fb.me/a3Oekp

Apply now! http://bit.ly/hpastaff

It's Week 1 of the Body-Bind Horcrux, and we're all helping each other break out of the Muggle Mindset! Rennervate by paying someone a genuine compliment! A positive attitude can be contagious.

You can read the blogs here: http://thehpalliance.org/blog/

Yesterday we said "pay someone a compliment." Today, remind yourself that you are beautiful/handsome. Post it your living area, write it on your mirror, set it as a banner on your desktop or cell phone! Be positive, be creative, and be yourself.

As fans of fictional books, television series, and films, we can be just as  influenced by the media and Hollywood, even if we don't scour magazines for the perfect hair style or exercise tips. This 6th Horcrux is an extension of the first, Starvation Wages. You can continue to sign the petition to make Harry Potter brand chocolates (put out by Warner Bros.) FAIR TRADE!
http://thehpalliance.org/action/campaigns/deathly-hallows/horcrux-1/

and join us to learn about Chocolate and Child Slavery! http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

Evanna Lynch has signed on with the Not In Harry's Name campaign! Read her letter here: http://thehpalliance.org/action/campaigns/deathly-hallows/horcrux-1/not-in-harrys-name/

http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

In 2001, some of the world's largest chocolate production companies signed an agreement that child labor/slavery after 2008 would be illegal.
Learn more with us now: http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

Most of the world's chocolate comes from the Ivory Coast, which is also a leader in child trafficking. Children as young as seven are transported every day.
Join us in the chat:
http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

To find the truth, the team had to go undercover because the CEOs and officials they sought out said that there is no child slavery in the Ivory Coast.
http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

Children are sold for about 230 euro. That's about $340 today. Most of them never get paid.
http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter
Join us here, www.livestream.com/imaginebetter - we're speaking with Robin Romano and Simon Billenness about child slavery and the film, The Dark Side of Chocolate.
Find a screening toolkit for The Dark Side of Chocolate here:  http://www.laborrights.org/stop-child-forced-labor/cocoa-campaign/resources/12401
If Harry Potter chocolate went fair trade it would be “One of the best things that could happen to fair trade” – Robin Romano

Remember the Starvation Wages petition? It's still open! We have 15,000 signatures but we still want more - we'll be delivering this to Warner Bros and Time Warner. After researching into it - the company Warner Bros uses to make its Harry Potter chocolate received an F for its fair trade practices. SIGN THE PETITION! 

http://thehpalliance.org/action/campaigns/deathly-hallows/horcrux-1/

Everyone, we need to make a statement! We need to show Time Warner and Warner Brothers we're serious about them making Harry Potter Chocolate Fair Trade! We will not indulge in Harry Potter chocolate during this years LeakyCon 2011!

...and there you have it. We are off the air - thank you so much to everyone that joined us. If you missed it or have any questions please reach out to us here, on Twitter (TheHPAlliance) or info@thehpalliance.org - THE 6TH HORCRUX - THE CHILD SLAVERY HORCRUX IS OFFICIALLY UNDERWAY! http://thehpalliance.org/action/campaigns/deathly-hallows/horcrux-6/

Seven years after the genocide conducted amongst them, Rwandans take one in a series of steps towards healing their broken nation by vowing to make fighting the climate crisis a top priority.

"If so many people across the globe accept climate change is happening, why aren't we taking more action to tackle it? Is it something to do with how we think, our culture, money or the lack of leadership?"

Social scientists say that our behavior shows that we are (possibly innately) less inclined to act in favor of long-term gains and more inclined to work for short-term rewards.  With this in mind, can "nudge" theory make a significant change in not our conscious attitude but our behavioral attitude towards climate change?

In her latest blog, Heather answers the question, "Can letting nature just do its thing be profitable?"  Read on to take a fascinating peek at the goods and services nature itself provides!

Sorry about the Nargles with the Splashlife submissions, everyone! We are working on figuring out what's going on, and will be extending the submission date. Stay tuned for more details!

Hey everyone! The submission period for the Splashlife contests was extended since we had some issues due to so much traffic! Get yours in ASAP to beat out any more glitches! This also means that the voting won't begin for 1 day and 7 hours as of right now! Sorry for anyone who was totally inconvenienced and we look forward to your AWESOME ideas and art!

Did you work on an idea or an art project but didn't get it submitted because of nargles? NO PROBLEM! The deadline has been extended until Friday, 11:59 pm EST, so go enter now for a chance to win $1000 and possibly get reviewed by our amazing Board of Advisors!
http://bit.ly/hpasplashlife
Submissions to the Splashlife contests are due at 11:59PM EST TONIGHT!  Keep 'em rolling in, everyone!

A real life Sirius Black: Troy Davis is a man convicted of crimes he likely did not commit. At the least, he needs to be retried. But the state of Georgia is about to execute (murder) him at 7 pm ET this evening. We do not have a time turner. Please speak out. Please!!!!!!! http://dft.ba/-XQa
If you want to stop the killing of a man who is likely innocent and needs to be retried, please call the parole board immediately: 404-656-5651 (US code for those outside of the US applies).

An update for those following the Troy Davis story: the execution has been delayed, awaiting a decision from the US Supreme Court. 
http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/44592285/ns/today-today_news/t/davis-execution-delayed-supreme-court-weighs-plea/

Here's Kelly's Wednesday vlog! Let's discuss indie movies vs. mainstream movies!

Have you all been following Alex Day's grassroots climb to the top of the UK charts? Well, we have! It's amazing to see what we can do as a group of individuals dedicated to a common cause. This type of spirit and magic is exactly what makes HPA campaigns possible.

Now you can help HPA partner Alex Day, an unsigned unknown artist GATE CRASH the top of the charts by Christmas AND support the HPA with Matt Maggiacamo's new Forever Yours remix: http://dft.ba/-forevermatt. All proceeds will be donated to the HPA so grab Matt's remix today!

Matt Maggiacamo has remixed Alex Day's "Forever Yours" and is donating all of its' proceeds to the HPA! Get yours today at http://dft.ba/-forevermatt and make sure to also get the original by Alex Day and help him get to the top of the UK charts!!

Happy Holidays to you all!! As many of us will be busy celebrating this weekend, we will be offline until Tuesday! We look forward to coming back, and please keep downloading both Alex's "Forever Yours" and Matt's remix!

Our Executive Director Andrew Slack hopes for a Christmas miracle so that all children can be free, in "The Warner Brother Who Stole Christmas": - please read, comment, Like, and Tweet! http://thehpalliance.org/2011/12/the-warner-brother-who-stole-christmas/

So thanks to all the staff, past and present, for inspiring our fandom!
http://thehpalliance.org/2011/12/thank-you-kate-looby/

story: The Harry Potter Alliance added a life event from August 15, 2012: EqualityFTW.

message:
We've got a new perk for you all! At the $13 level you get EqualityFTW's EXCLUSIVE Maureen Johnson .pdf download of "1776: A History in Tweets"! 

You can only get it by donating to http://equalityftw.org/!

Andrew Slack says "I can't emphasize how psyched I am about this perk from Maureen Johnson. Maureen is a best selling author who is writing a short story just for us and it's the first time that she ever does any thing like this using "140 character limits" as a way to tell a story. And she may be the best Twitterer in the entire Twitterverse. This is kind of historic. And as Julian G. Gomez notes, because the theme is about the American Revolution, it's literally historic." http://equalityftw.org/

We just reached $12,000 exactly! You guys rock and so does this perk! You can grab it at the $15 level.

http://equalityftw.org/
And...we have a new perk coming later tonight! It's a doozy!
story: The Harry Potter Alliance with Carmela Radcliffe and Carmela Pasaoa.

message:
New Perk! Only 50 available! Get your Evanna Lynch signed copy of Sorcerer's Stone with her favorite highlighted passage! And a cute smiley face! $150 level! 

Grab yours here: http://equalityFTW.org
We're $250 away from our $15,000 goal today!!! You guys are amazing!
We hit our $15,000 goal for today! This is amazing guys! Keep it up and there will be more perks on the way. Stay tuned!

Evanna Lynch, Devin Lytle (of Starkid!), and Andrew will be on our Livestream channel TONIGHT at 8:30PM EST with updates on EqualityFTW and their upcoming project! (Thanks to our friends at MuggleNet.com for helping us spread the word!)
As many of you know, Julian was able to make it to LeakyCon after all! You may have been confused about that ... here he talks about why he was able to go!

Live now! Come chat with us as we listen to Evanna Lynch, Devin Lytle (of Starkid!), and Andrew on our Livestream channel! Hear some amazing updates on EqualityFTW and the trio's upcoming new project!
This has just been announced on our Livestream! For $200 you can get a StarKid signed Poster! Only 25 available!!!
And...another new perk has been announced! Get your Starkid Original Doodle for $300! Only 15 available!!!

Here's the third new perk for tonight!

A Joe Moses Costume piece! Only 100 pieces available. A $100 perk!

This is the last new perk we'll be announcing tonight. There will be one more announced another day!

For $700 with only 5 available, you can receive Evanna Lynch's phoenix pendant! This very delicate piece of art can be your treasured keepsake, or worn as a piece of jewelry for years to come!

message:

http://livestream.com/imaginebetter

Come watch Harry and the Potters Live Now! Sing along with us!

http://equalityFTW.org

http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

http://equalityFTW.org
You are all incredible! With $27,225 raised so far, we are more than halfway to our goal of $50K! Keep sharing, tweeting, and of course donating, if you are able!
Hank Green is going to be joining us for a Livestream TONIGHT at 6PM EST! The fun and the awesome are guaranteed! You can grab Hank's Harry Potter EP for a $20 donation NOW!
Merlin's pants! There are only 3 EVANNA BOOKS LEFT! Whoa!! Better claim yours ASAP before they're gone!

We believe that together, we can surpass $30,000 (60% of our goal!) today, but we'll need your help! If you've already donated, share this link with people you know who would love those perks! Fans, unite!
Who's excited for Hank Green on the Imagine Better Livestream?!! He'll be on in just a few minutes! Join us over in the chat!

Hank is live right now! http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

Also, get some perks for your donation now! (Only 3 copies of book one signed by Evanna left!)
http://www.indiegogo.com/EqualityFTW
We are OVER $30,000 now!!! Thank you ALL so much, especially Hank and everyone in the Livestream cheering each other on!

Hank is reading what is commonly known as "The Bacon Book" since we hit $33,000! At $35,000 he'll release a (supposedly embarrassing) video of himself teaching Ashley Clements of the Lizzie Bennet Diaries how to vlog! Do you think we can do it?!
http://www.livestream.com/imaginebetter

Also, the Evanna books are officially claimed-out! But there are still more cool (some unlimited!) perks to be had! http://www.indiegogo.com/EqualityFTW

"My friend Mallory put this in the best way possible. This applies to everyone who lives in a democracy. And that is that, people died to give you the right to vote. And I think we kinda forget that..."

WHOA! We raised about $5,000 just during last night's Livestream with Hank Green!! In other news, Hank's new Harry Potter EP is actually a HARD COPY! (previously noted as a download.) And it seems that his perk is behind John's in numbers claimed... wonder if we could get a friendly sibling rivalry of charity going here? You can claim them both (and more!) here: http://www.indiegogo.com/EqualityFTW

There have got to be some StarKid fans out there! Have you checked out all the perk that they've offered? Pieces of Joe Moses' costume, a signed poster, and doodles! Limited numbers available!
http://www.indiegogo.com/EqualityFTW

3/4 of the way there! Some encouragement from Dan Radcliffe... gee, thanks Dan! ;)

http://www.indiegogo.com/EqualityFTW

While you're kicking back and keeping calm this weekend, remember to check out our EqualityFTW fundraiser if you haven't yet, and donate if you can! 
http://equalityftw.org/

We just passed $39,000!!! Almost to our goal! Sooo close! 

If everyone who likes this page donates at least $1 we'd hit (and surpass) our goal tonight! 

All of the unlimited perks, as well as a lot of limited ones, are still available too.  Support Equality!

http://equalityFTW.org

If you weren't in attendance at LeakyCon to hear Andrew's inspiring opening remarks on EqualityFTW, Leaky News has made the speech available in full text in this article: http://www.leakynews.com/equality-ftw-update/

$40,000!!! 

$10,000 to go! You guys are amazing!

Equality - It's that simple!
The folks at MuggleNet.com are pretty awesome, and also made Andrew's LeakyCon opening remarks on Equality FTW available in this article: http://www.mugglenet.com/app/news/show/5955

In our last Accio Books! campaign, we built the Imagine Better library in Brooklyn, NY, and filled it with books! What if we could build a network of Imagine Better Libraries connecting students across the world with the magic of books? We CAN! But we need your support to fund these kinds of projects. Donate to Equality FTW today!

We're beginning the homestretch before reaching our goal of $50,000! There's no doubt we can finish this, the question is, with how big a BANG! can we do it? How soon do you think we can bump up our meter to $45K? Let's pull a Fred-and-George and make this finale something everyone will remember!

message:
When we reach our goal, what will be the HPA's plans for this $50,000? Our three main objectives are immigration reform, LGBTQ rights and education. 

Let's talk about EDUCATION! 

While we discuss, donate. We're almost to our goal!

story: The Harry Potter Alliance with Darren Criss and 7 others.

message:
You have a pretty amazing opportunity to design the tshirt for This Star Won't Go Out, the incredible foundation in the name of Esther Earl. If you win, not only do you get to make an amazing legacy for an amazing organization that is giving critical help to families with sick children but you're name will be mentioned by John Green in a Vlog Brothers video. Seriously.

Here's a web page with more info: http://tswgo.org/blog/

And below is a flyer with more info as well.

Make sure you get your entry in by September 3 and DFTBA!

"When I tell people that I’m undocumented, a lot of the responses that I get are like, ‘get in line,’ or ‘can’t you just take the citizenship test?’ and stuff like that, and I feel like people need to know more about immigration policies, because [getting in line and taking the test] are things that aren’t available to a lot of people.”

http://equalityFTW.org
"It's a disgusting and abusive use of power from one of the strongest nations in the world. I mean, these are major human rights violations."

We're a little over $44,000! 

Keep donating guys! Almost there.

Thank you guys so much! With your help we broke $45,000 today! We have less than $5,000 to go! 

You all have been amazing through this entire fundraiser! Donate and spread the word! 

http://equalityFTW.org
"So, please. Take my advice. Go to your town (or city or county) hall and register, and make sure that you know where your polling place is, and above all, VOTE."
In today's "The Story's the Thing," Erin talks about the Divergent trilogy! Have you read it? Do you love it? Do you think stories can have a huge impact on education like we do? Tell us in comments!

http://equalityftw.org/

Less than $5,000 to go!

Big thanks to Kristina Horner for the Equality FTW shout out in her video (around 4:30)!

http://equalityftw.org/
Kelly got her Hogwarts letter! Okay... she'll be studying abroad for a while. But we'll miss her videos! http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WHVdKqPHSVo

So, have you been wondering about Accio Books? 

Well, March of 2013, we will be building another Imagine Better Library at the UNO-Garcia Charter High School in Chicago, IL! 

This library, together with our other donation sites, including the Bedford-Stuyvesant New Beginnings Charter School in New York City, will form the beginnings of the Imagine Better Network of libraries.

Education equality starts with giving EVERY child easy access to books! With the Imagine Better network of libraries children will be able to discuss and interact with each other around the world. 

To see this happen, donate and share: http://equalityFTW.org

Hey, everyone! Just so you know, the NING page is being taken down officially September 1st. We've grown enormously in the aspect of social media since its inception, and we hope you enjoy following us here on Facebook and everywhere else! Thanks for being awesome!
One of our goals for Equality FTW is to build a whole network of Imagine Better libraries! Read more about it on the IB blog!

Alex Carpenter FTW!

http://equalityFTW.org

$47,738? $48,000 sounds nicer, right? You know, because it's even... but seriously, let's do this! For equality!

http://equalityftw.org/

Tomorrow's September 1st. Time to head back to Hogwarts! But not for everyone... Lauren talks about what it's like not going back to school for the first time. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3OmA5C-EmTI

Just a reminder- the due date for this Star Won't Go Out tshirt submissions is September 3rd! If you are the winner, John Green will talk about you in one of his videos, AND, more importantly, you would be designing the first tshirt of an amazing organization named after one of the most awesome people ever.

That's right folks! Only $767 before we reach our goal! Can we get there today?

With your help we can! Spread the word and donate: http://equalityFTW.org

Also, for all of you Starkid fans there is only 1 Starkid Original Doodle available! If you want it, act fast.

"In the spirit of getting to know your bloggers better, we will be answering a string of sometimes serious, sometimes silly questions in the coming weeks. Please feel free to ask us something in the comments. We want to tell you what you’d like to know!"

That's right! Only $304 away from our goal! Can we reach it by midnight tonight?

As we reach the $50,000 mark remember what we are asking you to donate towards. 

EQUALITY!

Immigration reform
LGBTQ rights
Equal Access to Education 

And...just because it's so awesome I'll have to post this image yet again! 

Share if you're for equality! http://equalityFTW.org

I can't believe we did this! This is so exciting!

Thank you!!! We couldn't have done it without each and every one of you!

There are still great perks available and we're still going to have the page open until September 8. 

Thank you so, so, so much for helping us toward our goal, and there's still time to donate! 

Share and comment!

http://equalityFTW.org
Again, thank you all very much! Equality, for the win!
Let's celebrate!

"She has an American birth certificate and an American passport, and yet still they want someone who was there when she was born to sign a document saying they were there when she was born in the US."

"Thanks to your help, the HPA can work towards building another Imagine Better library, can work even harder towards full marriage equality in four key states this November, and put resources towards other campaigns in the future."

"Age and numbers are really arbitrary and all this meaning that we put behind them is mostly due to social constructs. Turning 20 doesn't mean that I suddenly have to be this very serious adult person. I don't think that I ever will or have to be."

story: The Harry Potter Alliance added a life event from September 5, 2012: Gogofactor Campaign of the Week.

message: "What do you do when you've grown up and your life no longer has a syllabus? You freakin' live it."

Is there a perk that you were really excited about getting, but didn't get the chance to donate yet? Don't fret! The Equality FTW fundraiser will still go until September 8th, as promised, even though we so spectacularly reached our goal! You still have time!

You can now claim a US LeakyCon Behind the Scenes for $125 and a Special Signed copy of Dear Mr. Potter for $150! Only 59 hours left to claim those or any of the perks you might have had your cursor lingering over!

http://equalityftw.org/

(Super big thanks to the 6 people who already wiped out the LeakyCon London passes--WHOA!!)

Via an HPA supporter:

Hey!

There's this local org I've worked with, Extra Special People... they are a summer camp for children with disabilities and they also get together about once a month throughout the year for fun days for the kids. It's an incredibly beautiful place.
They are wanting to win the Chase Community Giving $250,000 and I remember voting with you and spreading the word when HPA was running.
Would you pay it forward to this very deserving group? You can't make people vote, but you can get the word out. Thank you! 

If you use this link, it will give "extra" votes for me to use:

http://apps.facebook.com/chasecommunitygiving/charity/view/ein/58-1710803?ref=469eeae22f

What does it say about MTV's opinion of their audience that they scheduled the VMAs at the same time as Pres. Obama's speech at the Democratic National Convention tonight? Are they assuming people who watch the VMAs don't care about the election? http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0xUTtdmxPIU
This is it! 34 HOURS left, and plenty good stuff yet to be claimed!

HPA Executive Director Andrew Slack just sent out the following email: 

I was supposed to send you an email today about our upcoming election campaign, Equality FTW: Vote 2012. While we're still planning on moving forward with that campaign this Sunday and Monday, I think it's more important that I take a moment to comment on the now infamous "Frankenstorm."

Both I and the other leaders at the HPA, wanted to send this note out to let those anywhere near this storm know that our hearts are going out to you and all of your loved ones. Please be safe and take a moment to review how to respond to situations that may occur during and after a hurricane at ready.gov. Also, in the event you are in need of shelter, text SHELTER + your zipcode to 43362 to find the nearest shelter in you area.

Please expect to be hearing from us VERY soon about our upcoming campaign. And to be candid, as I sit here typing this email with the wind smashing against my house, I'm thinking we should probably take on global warming in the not too distant future!

But for now: please be safe, please enjoy being inside, and if you have a flashlights, I hope you have the opportunity to curl up with a good book.

The Weapon We Have Is Love,

Andrew Slack
HPA, Executive Director

"This week’s question: If you could do anything you wanted for a whole day, what would it be?"

"We are a culture gifted with beautiful hero's journeys and yet there is no apparatus, structure, movement, or institution that encourages us to mirror and convert these hero's' journeys, which we have internalized, into a conscious space for each of us to act as the hero in our journey of personhood and our journey for our collective humanity.

Our mythology has the power to wound and destroy. But it also has the power to speak deeply to us; so deeply, in fact, that we can deepen our experience as human beings and as a collective.

And such sacred power, no one owns. Yes, no one owns a story. It belongs to the world, for it came from the soul of the world. 

A story has power that must be held with love for a story can magically melt walls of our separate rooms that contain separate work: over here, the yoga studio, the therapist's office, the acupuncturist's room, the scientist's laboratory, the artist's studio. Over there: the LGBTQ meeting, the anti-poverty group, the anti-genocide group, the environmental group, the Occupy meeting, the corporate responsibility meeting. Over there: the after school, the History classroom, Social Studies, Literature. Over there: the hospice, the temple, the church, the funeral home, the maternity ward, the bed of a birthing mother, the bath of a birthing mother. Over there: the night clubs, bars, sporting stadiums, theaters, parks, hotels, hostels, conferences, tv's, computers, smart phones, radios, tablets, neighborhood, bookstores, restaurants, farmer's market.

The walls of each room that separate these dimensions come tumbling down and melt in the face of story - organize and synthesize in a unified multiverse of art, healing, activism, education and recreation, entertainment, holy sites, sites of sin - all of together as one - where billions of heroes live our journeys as separate shining stars in the sky; whose songs of suffering, joy, and separation are pulled to the extreme as a rubber band, until we pop to the other end as one unified story: one hero crying against the cross of existence, "O, Father! Why hast thou forsaken me?" And in the silence of that cry - the echoes and reverberations of that cry....come resurrection."
-Andrew Slack

Friends,

It is with a broken heart that I discuss the loss of a beloved friend, Sifa Nsengimana. She was killed in a car accident at the age of 37, leaving behind her extraordinary husband, two extraordinary children, a huge family of relatives and friends, countless orphans and genocide survivors, and our human family.

Many of you knew Sifa or knew of her while many have never heard of her. And so I should make this clear: by being part of the HPA on any level, you have been touched by Sifa. 

Sifa was our most prominent and beautiful voice for human rights over podcast/livestream/bllogging as well as a trusted advisor on our advocacy. Further, without Sifa (and her work with former HPA Board member Sarah Newberry), there would be no Accio Books. There would be no Candles For Rwanda project that we put together, that led to the HPA's first ever collaboration with John and Hank Green and Nerdfighteria. A collaboration which would eventually lead to Helping Haiti Heal/Chase grant/the "With Esther" video/perhaps P4A becoming a fundraiser.

For that matter, there would be no ASYV youth village in Rwanda where she was founding Executive Director (our community is only a very small part of the equivalent of what appears to be 10,000 lifetimes of work).

While the HPA is currently working on Equality FTW, it is of great importance to me that we remember our roots in the human rights movement (a movement that is in essence the same as all movements for Civil Rights). It is of great importance to me as we, this April, approach yet another anniversary of the 1994 Rwandan genocide, that we do something to honor her memory. Giving her as our creative director Acacia Ludwig referred to it as: a hero's farewell.

Sifa's middle name was (it will make many of us friends of Esther Earl smile, "Esther"), named after a queen that she very consciously emulated. She came from a beautiful family and survived human rights abuses when she was much younger. She fled to Canada. There, she experienced from a distance, the horrors of the Rwandan genocide where over 80 of her relatives were killed. Our Western media did not report on the genocide. The television only told Sifa of OJ Simpson's White Ford Bronco. It was only through her relatives calls to her, that she learned any thing of what was going on. Some were killed while on the phone with her.

At the start of the genocide in Darfur, Sifa did the only actual sensible thing any one would do (and yet who actually does this?): she dropped everything. She left law school at Boston College, a dream of hers, and committed herself as a leader of the burgeoning anti-genocide movement. When Sifa and I met five years ago, she told me that the tragedy of the world allowing genocide in Darfur was like the memory of her lost loved ones were being spit on. That the world said, "Never Again" in the wake of Rwanda's 1994 genocide and still did next to nothing in regards to Darfur, rallied Sifa to move heaven and earth. And any one who has heard Sifa speak, knows what I mean when we say that that her heart could move heaven and earth (I believe, and hope, that it has). Not only with her fierce determination but with her spectacular grace, warmth, humility, curiosity, and humor.

Eventually, she moved with her family back to her home continent where she co-founded the ASYV youth village in Rwanda. She was in the middle of looking for an agent for her memoirs as well as creating a new orphanage in her home of South Africa when she was killed last week in a car accident. Apparently her plans for this orphanage were (like the work of our greatest visionaries) extraordinary, genius, and not replicable. I have been told that it was still too early for any one to step in and complete this project as Sifa envisioned it.

Please let me know if you are interested in our long interviews (some never yet published) and please lend any ideas you may have for how we may work to honor the memory of one of my greatest hero's and a human being who has touched our world with spectacular grace, warmth, humility, curiosity, friendship, humor, and love.

And of course, now and always, the Weapon We Have Is Love,

Andrew

I always talk about how no girls liked me growing up. that wasn't true. none of the girls that I wanted to like me, liked me growing up. the girls who liked me (there weren't many but they existed), I never liked them. "I’m not usually one for reading sci-fi (and I tend to consider any novel set on a completely different planet sci-fi), but I ended up picking up The Knife of Never Letting Go by Patrick Ness a few years ago..."

Seven books, seven years at Hogwarts, seven horcruxes. And seven Chakras. In the non-Western vision of the world be it Ayurvedic or Chinese medicine, there are generally thought to be seven Chakras. And amazingly enough, each of these chakras has a relationship with each Harry Potter book.

The first Chakra is centered on roots. In the first Harry Potter book, Harry learns his roots as a Wizard.

The second Chakra is centered around the sexual. In the second Harry Potter book, Harry is attacked by a giant phallus in a dark chamber. SHIZAM!

The third Chakra is centered on power. In the third Harry Potter book, Harry is confronted with his own power as a man in the form of Sirius Black (who represents Harry's emerging manhood as Harry learns how to use his wand to create a stag that is actually his dad. #gotfreud - this is all about power.

The fourth Chakra is centered on the heart and links the lower three and higher three chakras together. The fourth Harry Potter book is the heart of the series, linking the first three books into an epic narrative that extends into the last three books.

The fifth Chakra is centered on voice and communication. In the fifth Harry Potter book, Harry has his voice cut off as the Ministry and Daily Prophet call him a liar. He emerges triumphant, his voice intact.

The sixth Chakra is the third eye, centered on intuition. In the sixth Harry Potter book, Dumbledore takes Harry on a journey centered on intuition where he literally tells him that now they are going into the realm of speculation.

The seventh Chakra, the Crown Chakra, is centered on transcendence. The seventh Harry Potter book is essentially about Harry taking on the role of the Christ at King's Cross (with Christ as King, and also let's not forget, wearing a "crown") and allowing for the mystical emergence of wandlore, death, and resurrection.

In all of human history, there are few leaders who have inspired so many as Aung San Suu Kyi. In an HPA podcast in 2008, Andrew Slack and HPA advisor Simon Billenness referred to this Nobel Peace Prize Laureate as a living example of Harry Potter for our world. Now it turns out, while she was imprisoned, Suu Kyi admits that she was inspired by the Harry Potter books to carry on!
Which Show Us the Report video has been your favorite so far? Here's the first one that went live-- Alex Day's!

Many people think that those who break the law are "bad" and "wrong." While it's a good idea to generally follow laws, breaking laws does not make someone inherently wrong. Martin Luther King Jr said that an unjust law was no law at all. 

He and Gandhi, Mandela, Aung Suu Kyi were perfectly willing to break unjust laws and get arrested for doing so. Harry, Hermione, Ron and every member of the Order of the Phoenix and Dumbledore's Army broke the law. Katniss Everdeen broek the law. Jean Valjean broke the law. The very concept of the United States of America was founded by men and women who broke the law. 

And let's not forget Galileo, Thich Naht Hanh, Thoreau, Joan of Arc, Socrates, Oscar Wilde, and the slogan "well behaved women rarely make history." Once again, we're not encouraging that people should be breaking laws but we are encouraging that we question the notion that the rule of law is what makes someone right.

After all, no single figure in Western Civilization has been as celebrated and revered as Jesus Christ. A criminal rabbi who transparently broke the law.

We're almost to 50,000 signatures! Great job guys! Let's keep it going. 

http://ShowUsTheReport.com

Here's some crazy thinking about stories and myths and how they help us in a larger transition of our journeys: 

every time you ever think the world can reach a state of perfection, remember that each month, countless people have officially reached the age of puberty. The journey of adult biology emerging through the body of a child is a complex path, made far more complex by an increased desire for social approval beyond their most familial circles. The journey of the adolescent is not one that simply ends either. It continues and it's themes come up again and again in the trajectory of so-called adults. Then of course, there is the biology of human creativity that emerges in these adults, sometimes resulting in the mystical experience of pregnancy and child birth.

Again and again, hidden biological voices emerge from the secret mist of each cell until the biology of the elderly emerge through the body of the adult. 

Eventually, the biology of death will emerge through all of our bodies. And within each transition, there is a hidden journey at play. Not only a hidden journey for each individual but for the deep currents of "relationship that underly all human experience" (Joanna Macy) into a broader and infinite net that extends into the infinitude of the Earth, the universe, the multiverse and beyond.

The secret is that all of Infinity is always here and we cannot be separated by the living web of reality. The rub is that our experience as small and finite focal points wrapped in mortal coil involves a near constant journey, and a complex relationship between the small and big selves that make us "who we are."

Our myths and stories provide a map to help us navigate these journeys. The characters come as actual guides, companions, and mentors as we walk that journey.

But as for the world: it's not about creating a world that is perfect. In the eyes of eternity, the world is already perfect. But in the wibbly wobbly world of time and separateness, we are not building for a world that has perfected the end of suffering. We are imagining a world that respects the complex, brave, and vulnerable journeys that each individual and community is on in this nonlinear yellow brick road where the Wizard has no answers, there is no end point, the calls for adventure continue, and paradoxically at our feet we are already home. And there's no place like home.

story: The Harry Potter Alliance shared Doctor Who's photo.

message:
"Harry Potter teaches what many great teachers from a diverse set of traditions have taught: love is the most ancient and powerful form of magic in our world.

"Love does not grab at others with hunger for approval and power, be that power in the form of dominance or subordination. Love does not wish to bring any one down with it. Love is not that part of us that enjoys reading about the woes of celebrities in the hopes that there are 'pretty' people more miserable than we. Love is not narcissism. Love is not narrow. What love is, is expansive. 

"Love is trusting. Love allows. It does not control – it allows. It accepts. It cares. It blesses.

"Like Harry, we can appreciate the pleasures of our world through Quidditch and Bertie Bott's every flavor beans. Like Harry, we can appreciate the loving friendship that is central to a romantic connection. And like Harry, we can truly do what the Dark Lord had no comprehension of: we can love in spite of and because of loss. It is that capacity that gives us a power that the Dark Lord knows not.

"The power of expressing that love is at the heart of our world's deepest fantasy. And since fantasy is not an escape from reality but an invitation to go deeper into it, love is at the heart of all reality. Happy Valentine's Day." -Andrew Slack

"In the US, a very small number of super wealthy Malfoy-like donors are bending our democracy to their will, getting our world's Fudges to ignore threats like climate change and radical inequalities.

"Malfoy never should have had the influence that he had over Fudge and the Ministry of Magic. Our worlds Malfoys in the form of super wealthy individuals and even more so, super wealthy corporations need to be prevented from bribing their way into our culture. It's akin to the dirtiest forms of bribery and more so, it is endangering our democracy and our freedom.

"Dear HPA: tomorrow I'm giving a speech at the Nobel Peace Prize Forum for one thousand elementary school students (there will be 3rd graders and 8th graders but the average grade is 5th graders). I'm supposed to compare Nobel Peace Prize Laureates with Dumbledore, which I'm happy to do. However, I'm concerned: how familiar are elementary school students with Dumbledore?

I'm assuming the answer is "very familiar" but as most of you know, the age group I'm more used to working with is teenagers. I'm also not sure if there are more relevant stories to the average 5th grader. I could compare Nobel Peace Prize winners also to Jedi, but I'm not keeping track of the latest stuff going on in the Star Wars universe for kids. Any input there, would be helpful. I think Gandalf is a great analogy but I'm not sure if that's going to be any more resonant than Dumbledore.

In short, do you think it makes sense to just go with Dumbledore? Thanks!"

message:
From our executive director Andrew Slack, "A Letter to My Fellow Heterosexuals":

"To my fellow members of the heterosexual community:

"White bigots have maintained they were right to keep blacks enslaved, killed, tortured, barred from voting, from restaurants, from certain sidewalks, and lunch counters, and bathrooms and bridges and yes, from marrying whites. But they lost. Just a few years ago, a bigoted white man refused to marry a couple in Louisiana because they are interracial. The spark of outrage has been so huge that the conservative governor of this Southern state has asked for this man’s resignation.

"Some Harry Potter fans have not liked what the HPA has to say about marriage equality. But I believe that those in the LGBTQ community will be granted that right. One day conservative governors from Southern states will look at those against marriage equality with the same disdain that the Louisiana conservative governor looked at those who opposed interracial marriage in 2009.

"And while there are many Harry Potter fans against equal marriage who have asked us to look at “both sides” of the argument, as if an argument had only two sides and that was it, I’d prefer it if you and I together could look at our privilege for being heterosexual in this society.

"We’ve never had to deal with the isolation of keeping a secret of our sexuality or gender identity. We’ve never had to reach for the courage to come out of the closet and face whatever isolation comes from that to say, 'Mom and dad, I’m heterosexual or exactly the gender that you thought I was.'

"We’ve never had to again, and again, and again, when we meet people for the first time, wonder if they won’t like us if and when they find out that we’re heterosexual. We’ve never had to hear about heterosexuals murdered for being heterosexuals and to fear for our lives on account of our sexuality. We’ve never had to fear for our jobs based on our sexuality. We’ve never heard about heartbreaking tales of countless men who mainstream society allowed to die of AIDS without trying to do anything to help – because they were heterosexual.

"We’ve never had to be told that we have no right to marry a person that we love. That if they are dying in the hospital that we cannot visit them and that our children that we’ve been raising together could be removed from us and given to someone else. We’ve never been told that we are not allowed to adopt on the grounds that we are heterosexual.

"Such privilege could make us pause. Could make us realize that when we talk down to people who are in the LGBTQ community, when we deny them their rights, we are denying people who have done nothing but acted on courage that we have had the privilege to not have to reach for in regards to our sexuality. We are discriminating against people who by their very existence to the injustices bestowed upon them have shown true courage, bravery, and yes, MORAL fiber.

"We are discriminating against our doctors, our soldiers, our artists, our police, our teachers, our ministers, our rabbis, our neighbors, our sisters, our brothers, our parents, and anyone we know who is LGBGTQ, including potentially our own children and grandchildren. Let us not skewer those who are LGBTQ any longer against a cross of social crucifixion. Let us instead look at each other as equals and learn from each other and take the lessons that we have learned from Harry Potter about the power of love, to heart.

"Harry Potter’s eleven years living in a cupboard for his identity as a Wizard reminds us that no one should have to live inside of a closet for their identity. Dumbledore, and we as readers, understand with great sympathy those like Hagrid a half-giant and Lupin a werewolf, struggling to live in the closet because of their identity. Dumbledore allows for them to come to Hogwarts despite the objections of those who know of their identities – in the HPA we have spent years working to create an environment where those still living in and out of the closet because of their sexual orientation will not be legally subjected to existential intolerance and irrational prejudice.

"In Half-Blood Prince page 624, when in the middle of discussing the prospect of a marriage that would challenge the status quo’s "perfectly normal thank you very much" definition of “marriage” McGonagall says, “Dumbledore would have been happier than anybody to think that there was a little more love in the world.”
 
"I think we all know deep down that one of the reasons Harry Potter is so popular is because it artfully conveys a message that is so very needed at this time - that the forces of fear, intolerance, and hatred come and go but they are no match for the power of love. In the Harry Potter Alliance we are proud to be standing on the side of inclusion, Civil Rights, and love. Standing for equal marriage is therefore an obvious fit for us. We believe in building a society that demonstrates to this nation and to this world that human connection can be based on the expansive principles of love rather than the contracting delusions of fear. We believe in working hand in hand, for a world based on human rights as well as the right to be human.
 
"Let this be a truth that is echoed in the United States Congress, the Supreme Court, the Oval Office, and the desk of every journalist, politician, and preacher. Let it be a truth that echoes far beyond US borders, into every corner of our world.
 
"In the words of the greatest Wizard in the world, 'Differences of habit and language are nothing at all if our aims are identical and our hearts are open.' Let our hearts remain open and our aims be for a world where we all have that very basic right to be human.
 
"And in the words of Harry and the Potters and the Harry Potter Alliance, 'The Weapon We Have Is Love.'

With Hope and Love,

Andrew"

message:
AN OFFICIAL MESSAGE FROM THE HARRY POTTER ALLIANCE:

We truly regret that our social media profiles on Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Tumblr were "hacked" by someone today. We apologize for any distress that caused our members. While we take absolute responsibility for the underdeveloped level of security we had in place, we're not sure anyone could have withstood this type of cyber attack. The accused person is clearly someone who does not support our mission to become a Dumbledore's Army for the real world, nor do they care about children’s literacy. We apologize that we were were down for the day, butt now we're back and ready for serious business!

From Andrew Slack:
http://www.out.com/entertainment/movies/2013/02/11/long-education-daniel-radcliffe?page=0%2C2

"I recently picked up my phone and texted one of my very dear friends Courtney E. Martin.

Me: I'm in a dentists office crying right now. OMG. I'm reading this amazing article about Daniel Radcliffe and what a versatile artist he is and the article ends with him talking about a TED talk he just watched that really inspired him. Dude. It's your talk!!! This may not be as big a deal for you as it is for me but wow. Just...Courtney. Wow.

Courtney: I don't even know who that is?! Will you send me the article?

Me: Harry freaking Potter.

Courtney: What?! That's crazy. Are you sure it was my talk he's talking about?

I was sure. I was sure because I've watched Courtney's talk over 20 times as every time I watch it, I feel renewed and inspired and filled with pride that not only is there a person in the world like her but that such a person is my friend. I'll be writing some more on Courtney in a bit but here is her talk that inspired our Daniel: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SXKNA_vfHWs

Here's the "money quote" of Daniel discussing Courtney's talk:

"Radcliffe is prepared for that. He watched a TED talk recently, on reinventing feminism. 'The speaker said that part of growing up is aiming to succeed but being fulfilled by failing really well,' he says. 'That’s what I feel this year has been all about for me. I’m looking at my work for the first time and not cringing. I’m going, ‘Yes, this is closer to what I want it to be.’"

I will be writing more about Courtney Martin in a little bit and her amazing work. Please stay tuned. And please check out not only this incredible article on Daniel but Courtney's amazing talk: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SXKNA_vfHWs"

From our Executive Director Andrew Slack with a very exciting and gamechanging announcement:

"Some MAJOR personal news: I'm moving to New York City this June as one of three Nathan Cummings Foundation Fellows. There's too many people to thank right now from David Fisher for telling me about it to Ashley Clement, Lauren Bird, Acacia Bowman, Paul DeGeorge for helping me through this process that I am going to simply forget a lot of people.

Here's the story: Nathan Cummings Foundation (NCF) is AMAZING, works on the issues that are closest to my heart, and just started a fellowship for three people to each be awarded $100,000, move to NYC, and spend an entire year within the vibrant community at NCF to be as innovative in social justice as one can be. After a long application process, I was just selected to be one of these fellows.

This is a very emotional thing for me. I will now have the independence, support, and resources to focus on so many of the ideas that I've been working on with all the Board members at the HPA not to mention close friends and mentors since 2000 (or earlier).

As an NCF Fellow, I will be extending the work of the HPA, focusing on CAMPAIGNS, CLASSROOMS, and COMMUNITY. More on this soon but here's a summary:

CAMPAIGNS include connecting the upcoming Superman film to immigration reform, the upcoming Hunger Games film to anti-poverty, and organizing baseball fans to become involved in community service. 

CLASSROOMS involve working with curriculum experts where we will teach teachers on a totally original "Imagine Better curriculum" that uses popular culture to get students more socially, emotionally, and yes: civically engaged - to become the heroes they've been dreaming of being. 

COMMUNITY includes building a tight knit network of fan activists (the Harry Potter Alliance, the Boxscene Project, Nerdfighters, etc) on making fan activism a coherent force to be reckoned with.

A crazy world warrants crazy solutions. We in the HPA/Imagine Better community are going to give the world precisely that, and I am so grateful for the validation and investment by an established foundation where I can spend my full professional time moving from the story of Harry Potter to all stories through the Imagine Better Network. 

What this specifically means for the HPA and Imagine Better as entities that are separate, similar, are the same will be determined through a very long process that our incredible board and senior staff are currently undergoing with the amazing company Refine and Focus (special thanks to Zach Braiker and Purnima Thakre who are some of the greatest mentors I have ever had).

I am still in shock that this has even happened, nervous/sad about moving from my home of Somerville to NYC, and so so excited at the same time. Thank you to so many people (too difficult to even list) that have made all of this possible. In the words of President Barack Hussein Obama, "you didn't build that." I didn't. Every step, every inch of our fledgling fan activist movement (and my NCF application) has been through the work of a community of friends, colleagues, mentors, partners, donors, media, and more. 

We do not dream alone. We dream together. Thank you for including me in your dreams and thank you for allowing my dreams to be part of yours. And together we will allow the beautiful dreams of humanity to help us transcend the nightmarish social injustices that besiege our planet.

For more: http://www.ncf.org/news/Meet_the_Fellows

I feel so humbled, so excited, and so grateful to every single person and so freaking excited to soon be in the nerve center of humanity at an incredible place working with fellow innovators as we shake things up. And I am also incredibly excited not only to be working with the two other NCF fellows but with the other finalists for this fellowship who all have amazing projects that are helping us to transform this world at a time that is calling for transformation and renewal.

DFTBA, THE WEAPON WE HAVE IS LOVE and let's IMAGINE BETTER!

Haven't got a lot of money for a Mother's Day gift?  What better way to honor your mother than by investing in women, FOR FREE!  Nerdfighters recently donated $50,000 in Kiva loans in honor of Hank Green's birthday.  You can do that too!

http://www.kiva.org/women
http://www.kiva.org/team/nerdfighters

Why invest in women?

*Women reinvest 80% of their income in the health and well-being of their children.
*A child born to a mother who can read is 50% more like to live past age 5.
*For girls, every additional year of school increases her future earning potential by 20%.
*Daughters of economically empowered mothers are more likely to follow in their footsteps.
(from kiva.org)

In November 2012, our chapters helped pass the Maryland DREAM Act as part of our Equality FTW mission to work towards immigration equality. As the United States moves closer to immigration reform, we’re launching a new campaign with our partner, Define American, called Superman Is An Immigrant. 

Learn more and share your story at http://supermanisanimmigrant.com
Did you hear that our Accio Books! campaign sent over 30,000 books to needy young witches and wizards? Check out this sweet article by our friends at Leaky News to learn more!

Julian shared his story, share your own and find out more at http://supermanisanimmigrant.com

"I’m Julian Gomez, 20 years old. My parents brought my sisters and I to the United States from Argentina when I was just under 2 years old, so I’ve grown up here, made all my friends here, gone to school here, and just about lived my whole life here. In January 2013, I received Deferred Action (DACA). Before then, I was considered undocumented; I couldn’t get a license, much less a social security number, as far as the U.S. government was concerned, I didn’t exist. Even now that I’m “DACAmented,” I’m in some weird temporary limbo where I have employment authorization for 2 years, but I’m still not considered an American by law. I recently graduated with an Associate degree from the Honors College at Miami Dade College with a 3.89 GPA, where I was paying out-of-state tuition even though I took the bus to school every day from the house my parents bought 11 years ago. I’ve been accepted to four universities to finish my Bachelor’s in Film, but all of them consider me an international student and can only offer me limited scholarship. So now I’m applying for a $45,000 private loan so I can transfer to, ironically, American University in Wahington, D.C., because I’m not eligible for any federal loans or grants, despite my financial need and academic success. If nothing changes from now to when I graduate in 2 years, I’ll be a recent graduate with at least $90,000 in student loan debt. This is because the country I’ve called home for the last 18 years doesn’t consider me a part of it. Despite this, I’m a privileged DREAMer, because of the over 65,000 undocumented students that graduate from American high schools every year, only 5% can afford to go to college. I urge you to support immigration reform, it is the American way."

This all-too common story of families torn apart by deportation is more powerful than a locomotive. Yesterday some of these families were able to reunite for the first time in years at the border thanks to United We Dream.

“Superman is born on Krypton; he came to this country with a promise of hope, which is the symbol he bears on his chest (that’s the S symbol). And so did millions of undocumented Americans who walk with a symbol of hope for this nation to be a better place, emblazoned on their chest and deep within their hearts. And not to mention that most of us come from families-- come from descendants-- of immigrants. We share Superman’s hope so we can continue his fight for truth, justice, and the American way.”

-HPA Executive Director Andrew Slack discussing our Superman is an Immigrant campaign with Maya Rockeymoore on WeTalkRadio

"Ding Dong, Prop H8 is dead. Ding dong DOMA is dead. 

"To all of my friends in the LGBTQ movement, to all of my fellow allies, and to the movement itself: CONGRATULATIONS! But we cannot forget our roots: the LGBTQ movement would not exist were it not for the Civil Rights movement. We owe it to the movement for racial equality to not only give thanks for laying the foundation for all of our success, but to band together in a New Voting Rights movement that will overturn the Court's decision to kill the work of Dr. Martin Luther King.

"We have a dream. And that dream is that all movements rise together. So let's celebrate the momentum around marriage equality while re-creating momentum around racial equality and the basic right to vote that countless individuals fought peacefully, and often died for."
-HPA Executive Director, Andrew Slack

Round 1: Thurs 4-8 pm, Fri 10 am - 1pm
Round 2: Fri 1-8 pm
Semi-Finals: Sat 10 am - 4 pm

Our Executive Director Andrew Slack has a major question for all members of the HPA! Please answer in the comments:

"Part of the HPA's Equality FTW is around education equality. And a big part of what we're focusing on is equality in our pedagogy: where students can self-direct their own learning and civic engagement through their love for stories.

"As such, I have been working with the Smithsonian EdLab to roll out a new program for after schools across the US. Me and the EdLab folks are right now working on an intense pilot program with a small group of young people aged 11 to 15. 

"Today was amazing! We watched part of Batman Begins, explored the hero's journey, created our own super hero stories (I am astounded by the creativity of these kids with their stories!) and decided on what kind of campaign we'd be working on together to improve DC.

"The Director of the program took the kids out to Union Station to take notes on what they noticed. The number one thing that the kids noticed was this: Union Station is not a place that is welcoming for either kids or the elderly. The EdLab Director asked them, "well who is it welcoming for?" One of the kids pointed to the adults in the room: 'You guys! It's all made for business people. Not us.'

"And so we voted on what our campaign is. We have created the Bureau of Re-Funification. The mission is to begin work on making DC a more fun place for kids, teens, and the elderly. Tomorrow we'll be going through DC to think of ideas. But the kids really want to hear your ideas too.

"So: how can our cities be more fun? More welcoming? How can we design cities where kids and the elderly feel like they are welcomed and where things aren't always so serious?"

Friday (today) the kids will be presenting what we've worked on and outlining their plans for the future. It's pretty amazing and I hope to see you there!

"Here are the details: July 12 at 11 am in the National Postal Museum's main atrium. We invite you and any others interested to join us for the presentation— see what a local group of youth has been working on throughout the week!

"The National Postal Museum is located at 2 Massachusetts Avenue NE, directly across from the Union Station. Exit Union Station from its west side (at the corner of 1st St NE and Massachusetts Ave) and you will see a sign for the Postal Museum to your right. Take escalators down to the museum's main atrium, where the presentation will take place!!!! Spread the word! This is going to be awesome!"

To the family, friends, and loved ones of Cory Monteith, the cast and crew of Glee, and all Glee fans, the HPA sends our deepest condolences. 

We have no doubt that this is a deeply shocking time and very difficult for any one to get their heads let alone their hearts around this terrible tragedy. 

We plan to mourn this indescribable loss together as we remember that every person who has benefited from Glee's message owes the memory of Cory Monteith a debt of gratitude. We in the HPA are amongst them.
In case you missed it: J.K. Rowling wrote and published a new book under a pseudonym! Will you be reading it?

From the HPA's Executive Director Andrew Slack:

The story surrounding the acquittal of Trayvon Martin's killer, George Zimmerman is causing a great deal of anger: some are angry that George Zimmerman was not sentenced to prison on manslaughter, some are angry at those people, some of "those people" are angry at "those people."

None of this anger, none of the name calling, and none of the very important and necessary discussions surrounding this case brings back to life a young man of 17 who was simply going to buy some Skittles and walk back to his dad. Whatever your opinions are on this case, that young man is dead. And there is absolutely no reason that he should be.

The case of Trayvon Martin's murder has raised a ton of issues that resonate with the story of Harry Potter including the charge of racism. Racism is an issue that effects the entire world and most certainly effects the United States of America. If we are to be brave, truly brave, we are going to need to talk about racism. Really truly talk about racism, about violence, about bullying and guns and violence and the complexities of the law.

My hope is for the Harry Potter Alliance to engage in such a discussion throughout our continual Equality FTW movement. But in this very raw moment when emotions are flying high, when people are in mourning and others are feeling defensive, I want us to go back to the most basic place:

The Weapon We Have Is Love. 

Right now, we in the HPA are sending love and our deepest condolences to the family, friends, and loved ones of Trayvon Martin. 

We are sending our love and deepest condolences to the family, friends, and loved ones of all young people who have had their lives taken from them by gun violence. 

We are sending our love for all people of color who are parents and fear that their children are not safe. And we are sending our love and compassion to all young people who fear that they are not safe.

Like I said, my hope is that we will get to a point where we have a more in depth discussion that explores the complexities of race and violence. But we are going to start from a place of love and inclusion. A place where all are welcomed. And a place of great sadness that the world has lost a 17 year old young man who was good and kind and funny and had so much potential for his future.

Our Executive Director Andrew Slack discusses some of his thoughts and feelings on the tragic loss of Cory Monteith:

"So. Cory died from a disease he actively had for the last two decades: the mental illness that is drug addiction. I had a strong feeling that this was the cause of death given his long term struggle with this. The disease of drug addiction happens to be one that has directly effected people in my life who I love the most - and therefore it has effected me. Our culture still views the disease as a moral illness when in fact it is a mental one. 

Our culture has a very immature attitude in dealing with complex problems and drug addiction is a very, very complex problem. 

Like most mental illness, it is hard for the culture at large to accept it as outside of the person's control the way we accept Type 1 diabetes as outside of a child's control. And it is true, that unlike Type 1 diabetes, addicts have some degree of agency. There is hope that they can get out of the disease based on decisions that they ultimately make. Cory made decisions over the course of two decades that showed he was a fighter. Even in March, he voluntarily checked in to rehab. This did not guarantee that he would survive the disease.

And the small window of reality that there was a chance that that person could have survived if only they had done something different. Or the notion that drugs are done by "the bad people." I want to say this: it is understandable that our culture feels this way. Human blame is an instant reaction to the human condition of suffering. But our culture's attitude that drug addiction is somehow a moral failing of an individual is more dangerous than drug addiction itself. Drug addiction is a disease that needs serious treatment. But so does our culture's response to drug addiction, to mental illness in general, and to all disease.

It hits on an even larger issue: the sociology of birth and death. We live in a culture where death is so feared that we would rather keep people miserable, hooked up on to machines in order to preserve the "sanctity of life" rather than the "dignity of life." The technocratic Muggle Minded culture views death as a defeat. And therefore, any one who dies as having lost. Voldemort felt this way about his mother. Most of us feel this way toward death, on some level and it's encouraged by our culture at large.

This issue gets magnified when someone is actively injecting poison into their body that will make them die or at the very least cower away from the reality of their feelings.

So let me say this. I only knew Cory through his acting on Glee. I didn't know him the way other Gleeks know him and I certainly don't know him the way his friends and family know him. But I still can say this: he was not a loser. He was a winner. And he survived under the condition of a disease that one does not receive accolades or awards for surviving. It is very difficult for any one to understand what an addict goes through - including the addict. 

This also hits on other issues around how we allow for grief and mourning and making space for it even when the way we knew that person was through the boundary of a screen. But my hope is that we can have a larger discussion around addiction as well. 

And I sincerely hope that if any ignorant and sociologically sick individuals are putting any thing up on the Internet that Cory is to blame for his own death, etc - that the Glee community can stand by and celebrate his strength. In the words of Jonathan Larson, "To people living with, living with, living with...not dying from disease." And even when we die from disease - and all of us will die, to not view that as somehow "not alive" - but to change our paradigm as to how this works.

This is immensely complicated and difficult. But we must remove blame from those who suffer from mental illness while at the same time allowing them space to find their own agency in the midst of their recovery.

Cory died. His spirit lives. Through the power of music and the power of performance and story - we can tell a different story about addiction and disease than the dominant story we hear in our culture's muggle minded paradigm. One that celebrates rather than condemns. That loves rather than fears. That empathizes rather than pities.

I'm going to say that last one again: "That empathizes rather than pities." Please think on that. So many of us would rather pity than empathize. Fix pain rather than be with it. 

So much more to say. Including the fact that our entire culture has the mindset of that as an addict and all of us need spiritual recovery from the depletion that we have suffered from. 

I cried when when my suspicions were confirmed that Cory died from this disease and it hit a very personal chord. This is very, very, very sad. Beyond any thing I can really say in an attempt at eloquent words. The loss is real, palpable, and truly tragic beyond measure."

An update from our Executive Director, Andrew Slack:

"I'm on a plane to San Francisco, representing Superman Is An Immigrant at a screening of 'Documented,' hosted by Mark Zuckerberg. 'Documented' is the story of Jose Antonio Vargas, the first Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist to come out as an undocumented American.

Jose is an amazing friend and collaborator and even personally coached and mentored the HPA's Julian G. Gomez in coming out as undocumented in a way that was nothing short of remarkable. To make this a moment of great pride for me, the film 'Documented' that will be airing tonight was in part made by the HPA's Lauren Bird who up until the film's completion, had been working for Jose since meeting him at LeakyCon 2012.

Needless to say, I'm very excited. This is a tremendous moment in American history and world history to help frame what it means to be an immigrant. It's time for all Americans with papers to press 'Like' on ending deportations and implementing comprehensive immigration reform."
On the anniversary of HPA Staffer Julian coming out as undocumented, he made a video breaking down what's going on right now with immigration reform. Share this if you learned something new!

"Today, on September 11, we send love to children who grew up without parents. We send love to those who lost partners and spouses, friends, family, and neighbors. We hope that the spirit of your loved ones lives on in your memories.

We send love to all those who have lost loved ones in the madness that followed the attacks in 2001. We send love also to those in Darfur, in the Congo, and beyond: to those whose suffering has been ignored in part due to this madness. We send hope that those who have been living in fear for over a decade can find safety and healing. We send hope to the children of Syria and hope that all Syrian civilians find peace.

And we work. We work with a deep commitment to become a better society… a world that understands how to hold space for grieving and how to listen to those who have not been listened to."

A message from our Executive Director Andrew Slack on September 11th #NeverForget
#NeverForget
