Our New York Dumbledore's Army chapter in NYC is taking action this fall to register new voters with their #Dontthrowawayyourvote campaign! Registering voters is easier than you think - whether with a chapter or on your own, you can grab some FREE supplies (today only!) from National Voter Registration Day.  Sign up to partner to get your supplies, and get ready to wrock the vote with the HPA the fall!
Announcing Restroom Revelio, a worldwide scavenger hunt to find and map gender neutral restrooms in your community! Help build a Marauder's Map for trans people.

Earlier today, we launched Restroom Revelio - a four-day worldwide scavanger hunt to build a Marauder's Map of gender neutral restrooms. Here are some tips and best practices for recording information as you embark on your adventure!

Support the greatest ticket in the Wizarding World with the Granger/Lovegood swag bundle, packed full of great gear to show your support for witches that get things done!  Notebook and pencils send you back to school or on the campaign trail in style, along with a rad sticker and shades to keep you cool - all for only $15.  Show off your passion for witches in the White House and get a jump on your back to school gear at a super sweet price.  Grab this great bundle today at https://store.dftba.com/products/granger-lovegood-accessory-kit
Going out this weekend? Keep an eye out for gender neutral bathrooms and log them in Refuge Restrooms as part of Restroom Revelio!

Restroom Revelio continues today and tomorrow! Join wizard activists everywhere who are building a Marauders Map of gender neutral restrooms via Refuge Restrooms. We've already seen options popping up in city halls, libraries, burrito shops, and concert venues. Where are you mapping today?

Whether you're exercising, taking part in Restroom Revelio, or walking the length of Diagon Alley getting school supplies, make your steps count by joining the Road to Hogwarts 2!  Sign up by Sept 1 to begin your journey and snag a medal and t-shirt!  roadtohogwarts.org

"Visibility is powerful. So many trans people describe not being able to place that slippery shifting something is not quite right feeling until meeting a trans person for the first time. Representation makes real the possibility of our lives. Visibility shines a light on others’ paths, saying, yes, you can walk here too."

Our livestream is tonight at 6pm EDT! Tune in to learn how you can register to vote and how you can motivate your friends and family to do the same. We'll have special guests and wizard shenanigans that you won't want to miss! For now, check out wizardrockthevote.com.

There's still time to invite all of your friends to our Wizard Rock the Vote livestream! We'll be hanging out with special guests MuggleCast, HeadCount, and Movement 2016. Cancel any plans you have, because you won't want to miss this!

message: It's exhausting work being a wizard activist -- get your caffeine fix with a bit of Weasley flair with this coffee mug featuring wise words from Ginny herself! Available exclusively at wizardrockthevote.com
Our Wizard Rock the Vote livestream is happening NOW! Join us for a night of magic, democracy, and goof. Learn more about our campaign and donate at wizardrockthevote.com.
Already feel a presidential debate headache setting in? Start this long day off right by donating to and/or spreading the word about wizardrockthevote.com!
Today is Voter Registration Day! Change the future in just a few minutes through our magical voter registration page: http://thehpalliance.org/registervoters

Happy Azkabanned Books Week! Some of our favorite books have changed lives - but they've also been challenged or banned in schools and libraries around the world. This week, celebrate your right to read by grabbing some awesome Azkabanned Book Club merch at dftba.com/hpa

The West Wing star Mary McCormack and HPA volunteer Monica took a break from their recent walk & talk to wizard rock the vote! Check out all the ways you can help get out the vote at wizardrockthevote.com!
It's National Coffee Day! Celebrate with our Ginny Weasley-inspired mug, available only at WizardRockTheVote.com ☕️
Banned Books Week ends tomorrow! Tell the world you read banned books with some of our Azkabanned Books Club merch from dftba.com/HPA ⚡️

message: Our next Friends of the Apparating Library book club pick is Goldy Moldavsky's riveting Kill the Boy Band! Want in? Join here: thehpalliance.org/apparatinglibrary

Azkabanned Books Week ends today! Harry Potter is one of the most challenged books in schools and libraries across the nation. Celebrate the freedom to read with a donation of $11 or more to our #WizardRockTheVote campaign at wizardrockthevote.com and you'll automatically receive an entry to win a signed copy of Deathly Hallows by JK Rowling!

Making our voice heard by voting is essential, but sometimes the real world election coverage can leave us feeling uninspired. What shows, movies, or books about government inspire you to vote and change the world?
For the second year in a row, we've accidentally spilled pumpkin spice polyjuice potion all over one of our tee shirts. These are available only for a limited time at wizardrockthevote.com!

Wizard rock fans: wizhop is back! Our Fantastic Beats and Where to Drop Them compiles the fandom's very best and includes new songs. It's available only as part of our annual fundraiser: wizardrockthevote.com
Anything's possible if you've got enough coffee. Available only for a limited time at wizardrockthevote.com! Grab yours before they disapparate.
Our organization turns eleven years old on October 10th. Like Harry, we need some help on our way to Hogwarts. Help us make magic: bit.do/HPA11
In just a few short days, the HPA will be celebrating our 11th birthday! We're finally old enough to go to Hogwarts! What advice would you give to a first year student like us? #FirstYearTips

Just in time for our birthday, we've launched our matching fund - which means that your donation to wizardrockthevote.com counts twice! Thanks to our generous friends John Green​, Patrick Rothfuss​, Craig Newmark​, and about a dozen other rad people for this incredible birthday gift! Grab a perk today and double your effort to help us transform democracy this fall!
Just when we thought we couldn't love Ben & Jerry's more than we already did:
These tees disapparate Sunday night at 9PM Eastern! Don't miss your chance. http://bit.do/yerapumpkinharry
When in doubt, go to New York Comic-Con
story: The Harry Potter Alliance was live.

message: To make a difference, we must make sure our voices and our community's voices are heard. Hermione knew that. It's why she studied hard, mobilized Hogwarts students, and worked with her best friends to save the world. It's also why we are creating resources, registering people to vote, mobilizing GOTV efforts across the country, and making space to talk about and take action on global political issues and voter disenfranchisement. It's why we #CantWaitToVote. The future will be shaped by heroes who take action. It will be shaped by heroes like you. Join the movement by donating to and spreading the word about wizardrockthevote.com

Our 11th birthday is right around the corner! Don't know what to get us? A donation to bit.do/HPA11 makes the perfect gift. Our matching fund is still live, so for the next several days your generous donation counts twice. You can even get some magical perks for yourself while you're at it.
Our pumpkin spice "When In Doubt Go to the Library" tee disapparates at 9pm EST! Show your love of all things fall and grab one before they're gone. http://bit.do/HPA11
Harry didn't do it alone. Neither can we. Read a message from our Executive Director on our eleventh birthday:

Yesterday was our eleventh birthday, and -- of course -- we got our Hogwarts letter! Help us embark on this new adventure by donating to bit.do/HPA11 ❤️⚡️ (Thanks to generous partners like John Green, Patrick Rothfuss, Craig Newmark and more, your donations are currently being matched and will count twice!)

Today is the LAST DAY to register to vote in AK, AZ, HI, WA.,DC, GA, IL, IND., KY, MI, MT, NM, OH, TN, and TX. (Florida: your deadline has been extended through 5PM Wednesday.) Register to vote at thehpalliance.org/registervoters, then send the link to any friends who aren't registered. Make your voice heard.
Register: thehpalliance.org/registervoters ⚡️ Support the cause by giving to wizardrockthevote.com

For our eleventh birthday, Hagrid made us a cake... then used his umbrella to turn it into an enamel pin. Grab one of your own (for you or for a friend with a birthday soon!) before they disapparate: wizardrockthevote.com
Want some exclusive StarKidPotter goodness? Grab the A Very Potter Christmas perk (while supporting wizard activism and our voting campaign) at wizardrockthevote.com!
Want a postcard signed by Evanna Lynch? Want to support a good cause in the process? Grab one only at wizardrockthevote.com!
There are less than two weeks left to support WizardRockTheVote.com!

New York, Idaho, and Oklahoma: today is your last chance to register to vote! You can register right on our website in just minutes: thehpalliance.org/registervoters ⚡️ Support the cause: wizardrockthevote.com

Celebrate 11 years of the HPA with a donation to wizardrockthevote.com! Any donation of $11 or more comes with an entry to win a copy of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows signed by J.K. Rowling herself.
Support our work by donating to and/or spreading the word about wizardrockthevote.com; everything makes a huge difference!
We think a multiplying charm went off somewhere at wizardrockthevote.com -- all donations count twice! Better take advantage of it.

Our friends at Mischief Management have donated a few Con Of Thrones Valyrian Passes and BroadwayCon Gold Passes to wizardrockthevote.com! These otherwise sold out passes will get you the VIP treatment at two of the best cons of 2017 and they are available exclusively through our fundraiser. Don't miss out -- grab yours today.

message: LeakyCon will be here before you know it! Are you packing wizard activist gear? We'll have lots available at our booth there if you want to stock up. In the meantime, visit wizardrockthevote.com to find great wizard wears like this awesome Not Perfectly Normal tee.

More than 700 backers have helped us raise over $23,000 for our annual fundraiser, but we still have so much further to go. We're incredibly grateful for the support we've received so far, but we're still 69% away from our final goal. It's because of our generous donors that we're able to do what we do, and every little bit counts. With your support, we know we can hit our goal. Visit wizardrockthevote.com to make a donation and pick up some neat perks in the process. Can't donate? Help us by sharing our fundraiser page on your own social media channels. Everything goes a long way.
This just-for-Facebook-pals discount ends tonight! Don't miss out: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/wizard-rock-the-vote-2016?secret_perk_token=f2d65eda
There are 68 days until Christmas, but you can start celebrating early at wizardrockthevote.com. Grab A Very Potter Christmas before it disappears!

"Happy birthday to the HPA, the organization that helped a younger me learn how to find and use her voice. I love the HPA’s approach to youth activism. It’s an organization that recognizes that young people can and do make the world a better place, that gives them a space to grow and direct all their passion and enthusiasm. You can help the HPA continue its work by supporting its current fundraiser at wizardrockthevote.com."

It's October, which means it's our birthday! To celebrate, our amazing volunteer Heather tugged at our heartstrings and made us a cake ❤️⚡️

Ready to make democracy more magical? Join us for a training by the Granger/Lovegood 2016 Campaign Field Staff! Training starts with a livestream TONIGHT at 7:30pm Eastern. Join us for Voter Disenfranchisement: How Do We Make Democracy More Inclusive? Learn what voter disenfranchisement is, who it impacts, and what you can do to fight it! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3gzjGBrW8tY

If you were going to write a song about one of the #FantasticBeasts in the Harry Potter universe, which would you write about?

Find out what some of our favorite wizard rockers wrote about for our Fantastic Beats compilation - available for only 5 more days at wizardrockthevote.com!

Only a couple hours to grab some great perks from wizardrockthevote.com before they disappear today at midnight PT! Which of these special featured perks is your favorite?
When in doubt, go to the library (to start an HPA chapter) thehpalliance.org/start_a_chapter

Over 11 million Americans won't vote on Nov 8th. Not because they don't want to do, but because their immigration status means they won't be allowed to. When we fail to provide reliable paths to citizenship, we limit our ability to be the strong, inclusive democracy that all people deserve. Julián Gómez, Campus Engagement Manager of Define American and longtime HPA volunteer, explores what it's like to be young, politically active, and undocumented during the 2016 election.

https://medium.com/the-harry-potter-alliance/why-i-and-11-million-americans-arent-voting-b0fc75c2314a#.ivuyuivlm
Add more magic to your playlist: past HPA compilation albums are now available for purchase on Bandcamp! https://thehpalliance.bandcamp.com/

The Granger/Lovegood team is hard at work!  Check out the most recent and upcoming Wizard Rock the Vote trainings at bit.ly/GrangerTrainings2016! (photo credit to the fabulous instagram.com/buttermybooks)

Muggle media got you down? We have some tips for making media consumption a little more balanced and a little more magical

https://medium.com/the-harry-potter-alliance/making-media-more-magical-tips-for-a-better-democracy-d4db49b5c965#.se2s6mkw5
There are all kinds of creative ways to get out the vote! Check out this incredible GOTV picture from Folded Pages Distillery! What's the most creative GOTV idea you've seen or thought of?

Democracy is a global issue. What does political participation look like around the world? Find out first hand from our global chapter organizers on Sunday, Oct 30th at 12pm ET! The Global Democracy Forum livestream will feature folks from all corners of the world talking about what it looks like to make the world better in their country. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k5yU0wNCsIY

Halloween is just around the corner! Put some magic in your mouth with Wizard Junk (TM), available at Honeydukes, Weasley's Wizard Wheezes and all fine wizarding shoppes. Grab some wizard gear to go with with at dftba.com/hpa
Pssst...did you miss a perk you had to have? Our fundraiser may be over, but you can still grab a few great perks at wizardrockthevote.com!

Democracy only works when everyone participates.  Remind your friends to vote by sending them a howler: thehpalliance.com/sendahowler

Pro tip for making democracy more equal: volunteer to give rides to the polls! Can't drive? Do some research and edit our flier to let your community know how they can get their very own Knight Bus https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BzUCAywi1eQDYWhHQVdrSFlVcGM/view
On Halloween, we're the Scary Potter Alliance.

Love social justice & games? Us too! That's why we're so pumped for Rise Up! from TESA Collective - The Toolbox for Education and Social Action. Check it out & support the game today! https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1713701812/rise-up-the-game-of-people-and-power
Want to use pop culture in building a movement and changing the world? Tracy Van Slyke has some tips! http://bit.ly/2fHtT8z
Want to remind your friends to vote? Molly Weasley will send them a howler they won't soon forget: thehpalliance.com/sendahowler

Democracy doesn't work until everyone is able to wizard rock the vote. Our latest Wizard Rock the Vote piece explores how U.S. democracy is leaving out people with disabilities, and what you can do about it: https://medium.com/the-harry-potter-alliance/when-it-comes-to-disability-our-voting-process-is-leaving-people-out-34937976c79c#.7znoxwe3z

We love programs (like the Point Foundation) that promote LGBTQ leadership! With 44% of HPA Chapter Organizers identifying as LGBQIA+, and 7% identifying as trans, we know the incredible impact that young LGBTQ leaders can have!

Dumbledore's Army is growing! Are you a new activist figuring out how to contact lawmakers, plan actions, and make a difference? Good - the world needs you! Get some tips for getting started on all kinds of topics in our SPARK video series with the American Library Association: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLP3imAa1WlVnrNtNXYBZDlhFK4Abmhe8H

We think we can all agree that 2016 could use a little sweetness. That is why we are currently hosting the Great Chapters Bake Off! Now through December 15th, you can support the HPA Chapters Program by purchasing a baked good (or two or three) from one of our 200+ chapters in 30 countries around the world. No chapter near you? You can also purchase virtual treats at https://hpalliance.nationbuilder.com/gcbo

Hot off the press! We've got the annotated copy of Ron Weasley's Defense Against the Dark Arts: Politics for Beginners guide right here https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7Q6dotV853HV09PeFg5T2hxb2EwX1ZFenhrTjViUE4tVjMw/view

We're excited to announce our first #GLA17 keynote speaker, Emily Graslie, Curiosity Corespondent at the Field Museum and host of The Brain Scoop!! Register for GLA today to see Emily and other incredible keynotes at grangerleadershipacademy.com/registration.html

We're getting excited for GLA, and that has us thinking about how to turn ~everything~ into an adventure. Our pals Habitica are on the job! Their app will turn your boring to do list into a quest with monsters, friends, and even pets! Join a guild (may we suggest the Harry Potter one??) to try it out!

Delicious chocolate frogs made by our Pittsburgh chapter for the Great Chapters Bake Off! Buy a treat from a chapter near you, or donate a virtual treat to the #HPABakeOff: https://hpalliance.nationbuilder.com/gcbo

message: Our thoughts on the election & a few ways you can take action:
Who's seeing #FantasticBeasts tonight? What are you most looking forward to?
Our own Jackson Bird stopped by ScreenCrush to review #FantasticBeasts, including the casting of Johnny Depp and possibilities for portraying Dumbledore's sexuality in future films. #LetDumbledoreOut
Heading home for the holidays? Pick up some tips for talking about social justice with friends and relatives in our livestream this Saturday at 4pm ET! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RIlNbq3P-uY

Artists, writers, photographers and fans! We are opening up the next issue of the W.A.N.D to contributions from everyone in the HPA community. We are asking for written statements, art, and photographs about what the Harry Potter Alliance means to you right now, and how—as we head into our eleventh year, our "Hogwarts years"—our struggles, strengths, and experiences as individuals and as a group are parallel to Harry's. Celebrate what it means to be a wizard activist - get more details here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xmhW8ixAQB6vCXjQ2J_W0x0WIndRrhmwJNq19y7i7dM/edit?usp=sharing
Did you see #FantasticBeasts?  Are you on your way to the theater?  Tell us what you think - but no spoilers!
As we honor Transgender Day of Remembrance today, we've been taking a look back at the stories trans wizard activists shared during Protego medium.com/tag/protego/latest

We are excited to announce our second #GLA17 keynote speaker: Dylan Marron! Dylan is a Video Maker at Seriously.tv, the voice of Carlos on 'Welcome to Night Vale,' and creator 'Every Single Word Spoken by a Person of Color in [Film Title].'

Looking for a way to give back to some of your favorite causes? Our friends at Small Token have created a platform where you (and your community) can donate to the causes you care about! What organizations will you add to your list?https://www.smalltoken.org/registry/categories/for-the-kids

Want to see your writing, drawing, or pics in print? Submit to the W.A.N.D.! The Wizard Activist News Dispatch is accepting submissions about what the HPA means to you & how you are tackling the world's biggest problems with love, magic, and imagination. Send your submissions to wand@thehpalliance.org

We might not have the magical creatures of #FantasticBeasts, but we do have a pretty magical environment - and right now, it needs your help. Today, we're releasing a fan's guide to fighting climate change, including info on environmental justice, deforestation, factory farming, climate refugees and more. Wizard activists - grab your wands & magic suitcases. Let's get to work! http://bit.ly/FantasticBeastsFF

Want to train Dumbledore's Army? Want to help people tell the difference between the Quibbler and the Daily Prophet? Want to make a difference? Apply to be an HPA volunteer! thehpalliance.org/volunteer

message: Big news! For Accio Books this year, we collected books for Good Shepard School in Masaka, Uganda - a school built by our HPA Masaka chapter & other community leaders. Over the weekend, our shipment of 10,000 books and 23 brand new laptops arrived in Masaka! The chapter is now hard at work organizing the new library and changing lives. Thank you to Quidditch Uganda, Out of Print, Books For Africa, The Literate Earth Project, and YOU - the people who made this magical day possible.

Today we launch #NevilleFightsBack, a resource for magical folks & muggles working to defend the home they love from hate. If you feel like our problems are just too big too solve, remember the wizard who won the House Cup by simply standing up to his friends. Remember how everyone discounted him - until he kept the resistance alive at Hogwarts and helped to save the world. You don't have to have a lot of influence. You just have to stand up for what's right. Join us today in calling on our political leaders to speak out against hate: www.thehpalliance.org/nevillefightsback

We are thrilled to announce our Granger Leadership Academy Sunday keynote speaker: Dr. Adrienne Keene! Dr. Keene (Cherokee Nation) is a Native scholar, writer, blogger, and activist, and is passionate about reframing how the world sees contemporary Native cultures. She is the creator and author of Native Appropriations, a blog discussing cultural appropriation and stereotypes of Native peoples in fashion, film, music, and other forms of pop culture. 

Join Dr. Keene and our other incredible keynotes in St. Louis, March 9 - 12: grangerleadershipacademy.com/registration.html

What if the wands that wizards use weren't controlled by the wizard, but by the maker? What if Ollivander or Gregorovitch could control the spells you cast?

When HP released their spring update, they took control of people's printers, rejecting any non-HP inks people tried to use. Big deal, right? Right. When companies can change the way our products work without our knowledge, it can impact not just printers, but our cars, baby monitors, pacemakers, smart phones, and even voting machines.

Right now, people are pushing back by leaving one-star reviews on Amazon and you can, too! Check the comments below for examples, from the factual to the fantastic, and then write your own to push back!

http://boingboing.net/2016/09/19/hp-detonates-its-timebomb-pri.html

In Aleppo, government forces are trying to capture rebel-held areas of the Syrian city - and injuring or killing thousands of civilians in the process. While the violence can feel overwhelming, there is a great deal that the international community - all of us - can and should do to help the people of Aleppo, from supporting organizations on the ground to pushing our governments to help refugees. Here's a list of things you can do right now: http://www.upworthy.com/7-real-things-you-can-do-right-now-about-the-catastrophe-in-aleppo?c=utw1&utm_content=buffer98921&utm_medium=social&utm_source=twitter.com&utm_campaign=buffer

message: The winner of our Signed Deathly Hallows Contest is Christine W. from Belfield, Australia. Her fantastic beast, the Bumble, has captured our hearts at a time when the world is feeling a bit darker than usual. The Bumble is a small, plump, bright yellow sprite that feeds on positive energy and emits more positive energy in return. The result is an atmosphere of pure happiness wherever bumbles are found. So, it's basically the opposite of a dementor. We could seriously use Bumbles in our world right now, wouldn't you agree? Congrats Christine, and enjoy your signed copy of Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows!

The need for action at Standing Rock isn't over - in fact, December is a month of action to help the water protectors and remind the world that health, culture, and environment matter more than profit. Not sure how to help? Showing Up for Racial Justice has actions you can take if you have days, hours, or even just one minute.

Today, the Electoral College will vote to decide the next President of the United States. But what is the Electoral College? Why do just 538 electors determine who holds the presidency in a nation of 319 million? What does Alexander Hamilton have to do with it? Learn about the origins of the electoral college, modern critiques of this centuries-old institution, and ways to make your voice heard at thehpalliance.org/nevillefightsback

Malta made news last week when they banned "conversion therapy", a harmful, discredited practice that aims to change a person’s sexual orientation or gender identity. Malta is the first European nation to ban this practice - congratulations to the activists (both muggle and wizard) that helped love win!

We all know that librarians are superheroes. The latest villain they've been fighting is fake news. Be your own superhero by learning how to recognize fake news.

These days, there’s an overload of information. It’s the information age, after all. But more and more lately, plenty of this information that we are inundated with is fake. How can you recognized fake news? NPR has something to say about that.
“Happiness can be found even in the darkest of times, if one only remembers to turn on the light.”

Rita Skeeter must have started selling her Quick-Quotes Quill because there seems to be a more fake news lately. Some easy ways to check if something is considered fake news - Is there a byline? Are there quotes from sources? Is the topic covered elsewhere?

Stories are powerful. Stories like Harry Potter are filled with joy, and they inspire us to be heroes. Other stories - like the ones being told about Muslims and immigrants - are false narratives that inspire hate and fear. Yesterday, President Trump acted on these false narratives, signing executive orders that target Muslims, immigrants, and refugees. Today, take action to shift the story being told. Visit thehpalliance.org/nevillefightsback to counter hate speech, ask Melania Trump to share her immigration story, and write a message #ToImmigrantsWithLove ❤⚡️

(image via @womensmarch on Twitter)

Go to thehpalliance.org/NevilleFightsBack for a list of those senators, links to their direct lines, and a script for when you call. Don't let our education system be DeVostated!

When Neville’s mother handed him a gum wrapper, it wasn’t a coded message or a piece of trash. To Neville, it was a token of love and a reminder to keep fighting.

Sometimes we all need a reminder that resistance is worth it. Making calls, attending protests and town halls, running for office, and being a voice for change is vital - but it can also be draining. Today, help the movement by showing an activist some love and helping them stay in the fight.

How can you show love to someone fighting for change?

→ Write them a message of support, saying what you admire about them and the work they have been doing

→ Give them a call to talk about how rad they are and what you can do to help their campaign

→ Make a donation in their name to the HPA or another organization they care about 

→ Take them out for coffee

→ Go for a walk together

What do you resolve to do to show a friend they are loved?

message: Ready to take to the (virtual) streets? Become our Street Team Leader!

What are your favorite fan-created stories, videos, organizations, or pieces of art? We're celebrating them today!

Today is International Fanworks Day. From fanfics and fan art, to fan-made videos, conferences, and even the Harry Potter Alliance (that's us!), fan works have been re-imagining stories and inspiring fans for decades. There are two great ways to support fan creators that you love: Donate to them directly through their channels, and spread the word about their awesome work! So, what fanworks do you love?
Donations make the work we do everyday possible. Read our plan for resistance and see what your generosity supports: https://medium.com/@TheHPAlliance/our-plan-for-resistance-5af3e5e10cc4#.wx82j1c5o

Last week, Senator Warren, through the words of Coretta Scott King, spoke out against racism and the racist history of the new U.S. Attorney General. When she did, she was silenced - but she didn't stop working to get the message out. Want to persist and resist? Get some tips for speaking out in our Advocacy 101 video series.

You won't stop fighting for trans rights, and neither. will. we. There are LOTS of things that students, teachers, parents, and administrators can do to support trans youth and let them know that they are loved and valued. Grab some ideas for action in our Protego toolkit and #ProtectTransKids: bit.ly/Protego_Toolkit

When Death Eaters' restrictive and hateful policies threatened the students of Hogwarts, Dumbledore's Army refused to back down. Together, they fought for a future they couldn't yet see. Today, transgender students are facing new and old threats as their safety gets rolled back. You can help make sure that your community is the Dumbledore's Army that trans students need. 

Today: Take it to McGonagall.

Contact at least one leader in your school community - it could be a teacher, administrator, parent, or student - and ask them what the school is doing to protect trans students. Offer up actions you can take as a community from thehpalliance.org/nevillefightsback. They always said Hogwarts was the safest place in the world - let's make that true.
Your handy guide to finding ways to resist in your area #NevilleFightsBack

Lots of people are concerned about the similarities between the new U.S. Secretary of Education, Betsy DeVos, and Professor Dolores Umbridge. Both were appointed with no experience in public education, neither know much about how students learn, and both favor a dangerous political agenda over what is best for students and schools. We want to encourage Secretary DeVos to do better than her fictional counterpart, and to remind her that when Headmasters don’t listen, they don’t get to stay in power.

So this weekend, #DecorateLikeDolores and serve up some resistance on a cat plate. There's two great options:

1. Owl Post: Download our postcards, grab a stamp, and mail them right to the U.S. Department of Education.

2. Social Media: Use our postcards, or google an image of your fav cat plate. Tweet @BetsyDeVos, telling her what you want her to do in office, and include your cat plate pic. Be sure to tag it #DecorateLikeDolores. We'll be watching & retweeting our favs all weekend!

Will cat plates change the world? As awesome as that would be, probably not. But we have instructions from Fred & George. So go, make some mischief - and give her hell from us

Many witches and wizards will still need to work today, but that doesn't mean they can't participate in A Day Without A Woman. Here are 6 ways to make a stand.

The HPA is an organization that exists because of the dedication and hard work of its fantastic volunteers. For #InternationalWomensDay, we’re highlighting some of the amazing women that work behind the scenes to make our shared vision a reality.

To help manage our 200+ chapters across the globe, we need global Chapter Liasons! Krupa (@krupahebbar) has been with us since the beginning of her activist journey, and now serves as our Asia-Middle East Liason. Here’s what she has to say on growing with the HPA: 

"The HPA was my first introduction to social justice, and through the process of being a trainee, a CO, and now a liaison, I've learned more and been able to help more people than I ever thought (but always hoped) I would. I see the world in a completely different (and far better and more empathetic) way now and it's entirely thanks to the HPA!"

Robyn (@robyn_ravenclaw) is a GLA presenter and co-founder of Black Girls Create, a collaborative space committed to championing and highlighting the increased media representation of black girls and women. In her words, "volunteering for the HPA is important to me because I want to ensure that I am a member of a generation of engaged and empathetic people. And to do that, I need to be engaged and empathetic myself!"

The HPA would not exist without the donations of kind wizard activists like yourselves. Caitlin's (@caitlinrenegade) the one leading this effort as our Donor Management Team Leader! Previously a Chapter Organizer of the New York Dumbledore's Army (@HPAllianceNYC), she loves volunteering for the HPA because it "allows me to be my nerdy self while following in the footsteps of my mom, who has always done what is right instead of what is easy."

Camille loves volunteering with The HPA because she "wanted to fuse storytelling and social justice for as long as I can remember." She's done exactly that as our Chapters Manager, whether that’s through working on our Fandom Forward toolkits or leading workshops at GLA. 

"I can't imagine life without volunteering with the HPA. The most important thing I've learned from the HPA is that a group of passionate, hard-working people can make a difference, especially if it's coming from a place of love and nerdiness."

Marcella joined the HPA as a Chapter Organizer in Sao Paulo, Brazil. Two years ago, she became our first Chapter Liaison for Latin America. Since then, she has been helping chapters throughout Latin America to start, grow, and lead incredible campaigns and charity programs! Marcella's work helps women on multiple continents to develop their leadership skills and change their communities!

When talking about volunteering for the HPA, Marcella says "It is wonderful to have somewhere productive and accepting to turn to when all the news makes it seem like the world is just hopeless. The HPA is a place where I not only can be active in changing things for the better, but also recharges me to see how many other people are working against the tide of worldsuck."
Couldn't get your broom to St. Louis to attend this year's GLA? Keep a Mad-Eye out on our Instagram, Twitter, Snapchat, and of course, Facebook all weekend and follow along. We're @thehpalliance!

The HPA is developing leaders with powerful programs like last weekend's Granger Leadership Academy conference in St. Louis. We're creating accessible resources and building global communities to empower activists to fight for social justice. We're reclaiming the stories fans love as powerful tools that allow us to imagine a better world and inspire us to make it a reality. We're driving real social change, and we need your help to keep turning fans into heroes. Consider making a tax-deductible contribution to the HPA at hpalliance.nationbuilder.com/donate .

On Friday, a federal court ruled that three Texas congressional districts were illegally gerrymandered based on voters' racial identities. While district lines can be re-drawn for political reasons, doing so primarily because of citizens' race violates the Voting Rights Act, and we hope that this ruling is a step in the right direction in making sure that minority voters' voices are heard.

LGBT YouTubers have discovered that many videos on their channels with LGBT content, PG or otherwise, disappears when searching under "restricted content mode." The setting is meant to be screen "objectionable" content - but now, LGBT YouTubers are objecting to discrimination, expressing outrage that the setting keeps underage queer and trans youth from being unable to access content that could help them understand themselves. GLA alum, Rowan Ellis, shares just how harmful this can be in her latest video: youtu.be/Zr6pS07mbJc

Our chapter at the Ohio University partnered with the Women's Center to put on a trivia game highlighting the wonderful women of Harry Potter in honor of Women's History Month! Want in on the fun? Join or start a chapter in your area and bring a little magic to your community!

When in doubt, fight for the library! The White House has proposed eliminating the Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS). No IMLS means no federal funding for thousands of libraries across the U.S., meaning many libraries will permanently closes their doors. We need your magic to save libraries! Visit #NevilleFightsBack to give your representatives a lesson about the important role libraries play in slaying both fake news and really big snakes.

The NEA established the library grants program in 2006 to provide much-needed books for public schools in need. Since then, the program has funded more than $500,000 in grants to restock library shelves nationwide. The latest national budget plans cut funding for the NEA and will put libraries and those who depend on them in danger. Americans for the Arts Action Fund shares ways you can take action to support the arts:

Every girl deserves an education. Unfortunately, in many parts of the world, girls lack many of the same opportunities as boys to get the education they need. These photos showcase girls from all around the world going to school. These girls are our future. #WomensHistoryMonth

Books can be an incredibly powerful resource. We believe strongly in the magic of reading and the importance of access to books, and we’re kicking off this year’s Accio Books campaign with Words Alive. Words Alive is an organization that seeks to connect young readers with the books they need in at risk communities and increase youth literacy. We’ve all met our heroes between the pages of heavy books as children. It’s time to make sure that young readers everywhere get that chance. Organize a book drive in your community today and speak out on the need for diverse books.

You are your own hero. Much like comic book superheroes, we think you should wear your shield on your chest. No need to design a whole getup, grab our Harry Potter Alliance logo shirt! https://store.dftba.com/products/harry-potter-alliance-logo-shirt

Today is #WorldWaterDay & there are many places that need an augamenti spell. What are the water issues where you live and how can people help? Here are just a few of the movements for clean water around the globe:

Flint residents still do not have clean water, and you can help by donating *and* urging lawmakers to act: helpforflint.com/action

In Canada, First Nations communities are pushing for funding & control after years of unsafe water: http://www.amnesty.ca/our-work/issues/indigenous-peoples/indigenous-peoples-in-canada/the-right-to-water

In Kenya, Ghana, & Nigeria, activists are organizing around mining, water waste, & habitat destruction: http://350africa.org/world-water-day-water-impacted-communities-spearheading-solutions/

#StandingRock Water Protectors & supporters (pictured) are still fighting for environmental & cultural preservation by pushing for #NoDAPL. You can support the movement: http://standwithstandingrock.net 

At worldwaterday.org, the United Nations is working to make sure communities around the world have access to clean water.

Around the world, women of color are leading the fight for clean water and climate action: https://thinkprogress.org/women-are-the-ones-fighting-the-tough-environmental-battles-around-the-world-ed3c3a0e09e2#.s1395buyi

For muggles and wizards alike, water is life. What does climate change and water activism look like where you live?
